original: Hallberg, Seth Severin, överbibliotekarie, Göteborg, f. 3/6/86 i Lund av kyrkoh. Hans Emil H. o. Anna Cavaliin. G. 1. 13-24 m. Anna-Lisa Ekelund; 2. 25 m. Eva TheoreM. Mittag-Lef fler ska mat em. inst. i Djurshol|m a)-27, red. f. Sv:es off. biibl. access :-kat. 131-27, överbibi. v. Gbgs stadsbibil. sied. 27, bibi. v. VVS sed. 31 o. v. Gbgs högsk. bübl. sed. 38. V. ordf. i sv. sjöm:-bibl. 30-39, ted. av Roib. Dickson’s stifit. i Gbg bibl:nd sed. 312, v. ordf. 32-39, tryckfrih :omb. sed. 3i2, Jed. av Gbgs .läk:siäHsk. sed. 41, v. ordf. i Sv. bib’!:-iesamlf. sedL 46. RNO, LVVS.
translated: Hallberg, Seth Severin, chief librarian, Gothenburg, born on June 3, 1886 in Lund to the Reverend Hans Emil H. and Anna Cavaliin. Married firstly on November 13, 1924 to Anna-Lisa Ekelund, and secondly in 1925 to Eva Theorem. Children: Eva, born in 1917, married to Benkt Widegren, Stblta, Agnetia 26, Peter 30, Ftaul 31. - Doctor of Philosophy in Lund in 1907, licentiate in philosophy in 1911, honorary doctorate in Gothenburg in 1941. Assistant Librarian at the Royal Library in 1912, Second Librarian in 1917, Librarian at the Mittag-Leffler Mathematical Institute in Djursholm in 1927, editor of the official Swedish Library catalog from 1931-1927, chief librarian at the Gothenburg City Library in 1927, librarian at VVS from 1931 and at the Gothenburg University Library from 1938. Vice-chairman of the Swedish Maritime Library from 1930-1939, trustee of the Robert Dickson Foundation in the Gothenburg Library from 1931-1932, vice-chairman from 1932-1939, member of the Press Freedom Commission from 1931-1932, chairman of Gothenburg Medical School from 1941, vice-chairman of the Swedish Library Society from 1946. Recipient of the Royal Order of the North Star and the Litteris et Artibus medal.

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
